info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:11PM CDT until August 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT/645 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHEYENNE...NORTHWESTERN THOMAS... SOUTHWESTERN RAWLINS AND NORTHEASTERN SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 510 PM MDT/610 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles south of McDonald, or 15 miles north of Brewster, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public report of golf ball size 9 miles south of McDonald. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne, northwestern Thomas, southwestern Rawlins and northeastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
